ami.description: A custom AMI ID to use for the worker nodes instead of the default

desiredNodes.description: The desired number of worker nodes

ebsEncryption.description: Enables EBS encryption of worker nodes

associateWorkerNodePublicIp.description: A custom AMI ID to use for the worker nodes instead of the default

displayName.description: The displayed name of the cluster in the Rancher UI

serviceRole.description: The service role to use to perform the cluster operations in AWS

minimumNodes.description: The minimum number of worker nodes

accessKey.description: The AWS Client ID to use

keyPairName.description: Allow user to specify key name to use

sessionToken.description: A session token to use with the client key and secret if applicable.

secretKey.description: The AWS Client Secret associated with the Client ID

securityGroups.description: Comma-separated list of security groups to use for the cluster

subnets.description: Comma-separated list of subnets in the virtual network to use

maximumNodes.description: The maximum number of worker nodes

userData.description: Pass user-data to the nodes to perform automated configuration tasks

nodeVolumeSize.description: The volume size for each node

instanceType.description: The type of machine to use for worker nodes

region.description: The AWS Region to create the EKS cluster in

virtualNetwork.description: The name of the virtual network to use

cloneFrom.description: If you choose creation type clone a name of what you want to clone is required

sshUserGroup.description: If using a non-B2D image the uploaded keys will need chown'ed, defaults to staff e.g. docker:staff

contentLibrary.description: If you choose to clone from a content library template specify the name of the library

customAttribute.description: vSphere custom attribute, format key/value e.g. '200=my custom value'

network.description: vSphere network where the virtual machine will be attached

vappIpprotocol.description: vSphere vApp IP protocol for this deployment. Supported values are: IPv4 and IPv6

memorySize.description: vSphere size of memory for docker VM (in MB)

vappIpallocationpolicy.description: vSphere vApp IP allocation policy. Supported values are: dhcp, fixed, transient and fixedAllocated

hostsystem.description: vSphere compute resource where the docker VM will be instantiated. This can be omitted if using a cluster with DRS

diskSize.description: vSphere size of disk for docker VM (in MB)

folder.description: vSphere folder for the docker VM. This folder must already exist in the datacenter

vappTransport.description: vSphere OVF environment transports to use for properties. Supported values are: iso and com.vmware.guestInfo

creationType.description: Creation type when creating a new virtual machine. Supported values: vm, template, library, legacy

cloudinit.description: vSphere cloud-init filepath or url to add to guestinfo, filepath will be read and base64 encoded before adding

cfgparam.description: vSphere vm configuration parameters (used for guestinfo)

datastoreCluster.description: vSphere datastore cluster for virtual machine

sshPort.description: If using a non-B2D image you can specify the ssh port

pool.description: vSphere resource pool for docker VM

sshUser.description: If using a non-B2D image you can specify the ssh user

cpuCount.description: vSphere CPU number for docker VM

cloudConfig.description: Filepath to a cloud-config yaml file to put into the ISO user-data

sshPassword.description: If using a non-B2D image you can specify the ssh password

tags.description: comma-separated list of tags to apply to the Droplet

enableAutoUpgrade.description: Specifies whether node auto-upgrade is enabled for the node pool

ipPolicyCreateSubnetwork.description: Whether a new subnetwork will be created automatically for the cluster

enableMasterAuthorizedNetwork.description: Whether or not master authorized network is enabled

locations.description: Locations to use for the cluster

ipPolicyNodeIpv4CidrBlock.description: The IP address range of the instance IPs in this cluster

subNetwork.description: The sub-network to use for the cluster

enablePrivateEndpoint.description: Whether the master's internal IP address is used as the cluster endpoint

minNodeCount.description: Minimmum number of nodes in the NodePool. Must be >= 1 and <= maxNodeCount

enableAutoRepair.description: Specifies whether the node auto-repair is enabled for the node pool

network.description: The network to use for the cluster

useIpAliases.description: Whether alias IPs will be used for pod IPs in the cluster

ipPolicyClusterSecondaryRangeName.description: The name of the secondary range to be used for the cluster CIDR block

serviceAccount.description: The Google Cloud Platform Service Account to be used by the node VMs

name.description: the internal name of the cluster in Rancher

credential.description: The contents of the GC credential file

masterIpv4CidrBlock.description: The IP range in CIDR notation to use for the hosted master network

enableHorizontalPodAutoscaling.description: Enable horizontal pod autoscaling for the cluster

imageType.description: The image to use for the worker nodes

resourceLabels.description: The map of Kubernetes labels (key/value pairs) to be applied to each cluster

labels.description: The map of Kubernetes labels (key/value pairs) to be applied to each node

machineType.description: The machine type to use for the worker nodes

description.description: An optional description of this cluster

enablePrivateNodes.description: Whether nodes have internal IP address only

preemptible.description: Whether the nodes are created as preemptible VM instances

ipPolicyServicesSecondaryRangeName.description: The name of the secondary range to be used for the services CIDR block

taints.description: List of kubernetes taints to be applied to each node

oauthScopes.description: The set of Google API scopes to be made available on all of the node VMs under the default service account

masterAuthorizedNetworkCidrBlocks.description: Define up to 10 external networks that could access Kubernetes master through HTTPS

enableKubernetesDashboard.description: Whether to enable the kubernetes dashboard

nodeCount.description: The number of nodes to create in this cluster

ipPolicyClusterIpv4CidrBlock.description: The IP address range for the cluster pod IPs

ipPolicySubnetworkName.description: A custom subnetwork name to be used if createSubnetwork is true

enableNetworkPolicyConfig.description: Enable network policy config for the cluster

ipPolicyServicesIpv4CidrBlock.description: The IP address range of the services IPs in this cluster

localSsdCount.description: he number of local SSD disks to be attached to the node

displayName.description: the name of the cluster that should be displayed to the user

zone.description: The zone to launch the cluster

maxNodeCount.description: Maximum number of nodes in the NodePool. Must be >= minNodeCount. There has to enough quota to scale up the cluster

maintenanceWindow.description: When to performance updates on the nodes, in 24-hour time (e.g. "19:00")

region.description: The region to launch the cluster

enableHttpLoadBalancing.description: Enable http load balancing for the cluster

nodeVersion.description: The version of kubernetes to use on the nodes

diskType.description: Type of the disk attached to each node

diskSizeGb.description: Size of the disk attached to each node

nodePool.description: The ID of the cluster node pool

clusterIpv4Cidr.description: The IP address range of the container pods

projectId.description: the ID of your project to use when creating a cluster

enableLegacyAbac.description: Whether to enable legacy abac on the cluster

spotPrice.description: AWS spot instance bid price (in dollar)

monitoring.description: Set this flag to enable CloudWatch monitoring

endpoint.description: Optional endpoint URL (hostname only or fully qualified URI)

encryptEbsVolume.description: Encrypt the EBS volume using the AWS Managed CMK

blockDurationMinutes.description: AWS spot instance duration in minutes (60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360)

privateAddressOnly.description: Only use a private IP address

sshUser.description: Set the name of the ssh user

retries.description: Set retry count for recoverable failures (use -1 to disable)

openPort.description: Make the specified port number accessible from the Internet

usePrivateAddress.description: Force the usage of private IP address

requestSpotInstance.description: Set this flag to request spot instance

securityGroupReadonly.description: Skip adding default rules to security groups

clientSecret.description: Azure Service Principal Account password (optional, browser auth is used if not specified)

clientId.description: Azure Service Principal Account ID (optional, browser auth is used if not specified)

aadServerAppId.description: The ID of an Azure Active Directory server application of type "Web app/API". This application represents the managed cluster's apiserver (Server application).

networkPolicy.description: Network policy used for building Kubernetes network. Chooses from [calico].

agentVmSize.description: Size of machine in the agent pool.

dockerBridgeCidr.description: A CIDR notation IP range assigned to the Docker bridge network. It must not overlap with any Subnet IP ranges or the Kubernetes Service address range specified in "service cidr".

podCidr.description: A CIDR notation IP range from which to assign Kubernetes Pod IPs when "network plugin" is specified in "kubenet".

aadTenantId.description: The ID of an Azure Active Directory tenant.

aadServerAppSecret.description: The secret of an Azure Active Directory server application.

authBaseUrl.description: Different authentication API url to use.

virtualNetwork.description: The name of an existing Azure Virtual Network. Composite of agent virtual network subnet ID.

subnet.description: The name of an existing Azure Virtual Subnet. Composite of agent virtual network subnet ID.

sshPublicKeyContents.description: Contents of the SSH public key used to authenticate with Linux hosts. Opposite to "ssh public key".

baseUrl.description: Different resource management API url to use.

resourceGroup.description: The name of the 'Cluster' resource group.

logAnalyticsWorkspaceResourceGroup.description: The resource group of an existing Azure Log Analytics Workspace to use for storing monitoring data. If not specified, uses the 'Cluster' resource group.

networkPlugin.description: Network plugin used for building Kubernetes network. Chooses from [azure kubenet].

virtualNetworkResourceGroup.description: The resource group of an existing Azure Virtual Network. Composite of agent virtual network subnet ID.

subscriptionId.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription.

dnsServiceIp.description: An IP address assigned to the Kubernetes DNS service. It must be within the Kubernetes Service address range specified in "service cidr".

clientSecret.description: Azure client secret associated with the "client id".

serviceCidr.description: A CIDR notation IP range from which to assign Kubernetes Service cluster IPs. It must not overlap with any Subnet IP ranges.

tags.description: Tags for Kubernetes cluster. For example, foo=bar.

enableHttpApplicationRouting.description: Enable the Kubernetes ingress with automatic public DNS name creation.

adminUsername.description: The administrator username to use for Linux hosts.

agentStorageProfile.description: Storage profile specifies what kind of storage used on machine in the agent pool. Chooses from [ManagedDisks StorageAccount].

aadClientAppId.description: The ID of an Azure Active Directory client application of type "Native". This application is for user login via kubectl.

count.description: Number of machines (VMs) in the agent pool. Allowed values must be in the range of 1 to 100 (inclusive).

displayName.description: The displayed name of the cluster in the Rancher UI.

name.description: The name of the 'Cluster' resource, and the internal name of the cluster in Rancher.

agentPoolName.description: Name for the agent pool, upto 12 alphanumeric characters.

enableMonitoring.description: Turn on Azure Log Analytics monitoring. Uses the Log Analytics "Default" workspace if it exists, else creates one. if using an existing workspace, specifies "log analytics workspace resource id".

maxPods.description: Maximum number of pods that can run on a node.

agentOsdiskSize.description: GB size to be used to specify the disk for every machine in the agent pool. If you specify 0, it will apply the default according to the "agent vm size" specified.

masterDnsPrefix.description: DNS prefix to use the Kubernetes cluster control pane.

logAnalyticsWorkspace.description: The name of an existing Azure Log Analytics Workspace to use for storing monitoring data. If not specified, uses '{resource group}-{subscription id}-{location code}'.

sshUser.description: Specifies the user as which docker-machine should log in to the Linode instance to install Docker.

stackscript.description: Specifies the Linode StackScript to use to create the instance

authorizedUsers.description: Linode user accounts (seperated by commas) whose Linode SSH keys will be permitted root access to the created node

tags.description: A comma separated list of tags to apply to the the Linode resource

image.description: Specifies the Linode Instance image which determines the OS distribution and base files

uaPrefix.description: Prefix the User-Agent in Linode API calls with some 'product/version'

stackscriptData.description: A JSON string specifying data for the selected StackScript

createPrivateIp.description: Create private IP for the instance

instanceType.description: Specifies the Linode Instance type which determines CPU, memory, disk size, etc.

region.description: Specifies the region (location) of the Linode instance

managedDisks.description: Configures VM and availability set for managed disks

subnet.description: Azure Subnet Name to be used within the Virtual Network

faultDomainCount.description: Fault domain count to use for availability set

usePrivateIp.description: Use private IP address of the machine to connect

resourceGroup.description: Azure Resource Group name (will be created if missing)

noPublicIp.description: Do not create a public IP address for the machine

diskSize.description: Disk size if using managed disk

location.description: Azure region to create the virtual machine

dns.description: A unique DNS label for the public IP adddress

availabilitySet.description: Azure Availability Set to place the virtual machine into

staticPublicIp.description: Assign a static public IP address to the machine

privateIpAddress.description: Specify a static private IP address for the machine

clientSecret.description: Azure Service Principal Account password (optional, browser auth is used if not specified)

storageType.description: Type of Storage Account to host the OS Disk for the machine

subnetPrefix.description: Private CIDR block to be used for the new subnet, should comply RFC 1918

openPort.description: Make the specified port number accessible from the Internet

clientId.description: Azure Service Principal Account ID (optional, browser auth is used if not specified)

vnet.description: Azure Virtual Network name to connect the virtual machine (in [resourcegroup:]name format)

updateDomainCount.description: Update domain count to use for availability set
